Posts.Content: HillD11 wrote: Hi, I've posted on the Paget's board but am also posting here because I'm trying to find some answers.  I've been having what appears to be an infection develop on my right nipple for the last 2 years.  It starts with tingling, pain, burning, and itching, then turns into what looks like a blister.  It then turns black, and then "pops", releasing blood and pus.  It's fairly disgusting.  Then as it's healing, the skin around the area peels and flakes.  There is some clear discharge as well.  No fever with any of these incidents.  Then, about 5-6 months later, it returns and does it all over again.  I've had this 4 times now in the last 2 years, same exact area.  I'm 48 years old, a non-smoker, and I'm not diabetic, which, from my research, are risk factors for this type of thing.  I've gone to two different breast surgeons, both of whom did not think it was paget's, but a breast "infection".  My question is, have any of you ever had this type of thing, and if so, what did you do to treat it.  They've lanced mine and given me antibiotics but it always comes back.  It's so irritating.  Thanks in advance for any input. Posts.Content: HillD11 wrote: Hi, I haven't posted in awhile..last December (2010) I had a BIRADS 3 diagnostic mammo..to recap, felt lump in left breast, sono/mammo confirmed it was benign cyst. Right breast had "loosely associated calcifications" and they had me repeat it this past July, last month. The results were essentially unchanged, no changes in the calcification morphology or number. They told me to come back in 6 months. So 3 days ago, I got out of the shower and after drying off I happened to look down at my right nipple (same breast that has calcifications) and I see some clear/semi-milky looking fluid on my breast, like a droplet. I squeezed gently and more came out. I have not seen anymore since then. Also, it was sticky. I called my OB-GYN today and he wants me to have a blood test to level my TSH (thyroid) and my prolactin. Not sure what the prolactin is looking for.  I know that certain thyroid conditions can cause discharge from breasts, and I am hypothyroid, but I am taking synthroid daily for that, and was checked in June, and my levels were fine.  I'm just wondering if I should be more concerned or ask the dr. to check anything else??
